title: How young Tory activists are helping the party prepare for a general election
text:
Young conservatives will play a crucial role in the party's general election campaign after being galvanised by Boris Johnson, Theresa May's former aide has said.

Andrew Bowie, who is now the chair for youth of the Conservative party, said that this year's conference in Manchester was the youngest on record, with a quarter of its attendees being below the age of 25.

He said that the Prime Minister's charisma has contributed to a swell in support from members of Generation Z joining the party.

The MP for West Aberdeenshire and Kincardine is hoping that a renewed social media push will energise turnout amid fears that an overall majority will not be won by relying on the party's older membership....
description: Young conservatives will play a crucial role in the party's general election campaign after being galvanised by Boris Johnson, Theresa May's former aide has said.
